body: Wrong branch :p

@natedogs911 
What about the INSTAL.md files , should we add something there ? 

https://github.com/apache/incubator-spot/blob/master/spot-oa/oa/INSTALL.md#operational-analytics-installation-and-usage

https://github.com/apache/incubator-spot/blob/master/spot-oa/ui/INSTALL.md#install-spot-ui
Thanks for working on this @solrac901 I really appreciate all the time and effort you to put to convert this doc, I have left some comments.

And a small nit, I'd personally prefer to not have spaces in the directory name or the file name. It seems like the current spot convention is to use dashes so may be "open-data-model" is a better name for directory and the file?

My only last small nit is that the directory name is using underscores while other places all use dashes. Do you think it makes sense to make it all consistent?

Apart from that all looks good. Thanks for working on this!

ahh was the only option that i have to change the name of the folder the github GUI in windows doesn't detect the change on the capital letters  that's why I erase the folder i will crate the old one not a big deal regards.
ok, thanks!

Issue: [SPOT-124]( https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPOT-124?jql=project%20%3D%20SPOT)
Issue: [SPOT-127](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPOT-127?jql=project%20%3D%20SPOT)
Issue: [SPOT-35](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPOT-35)

This is a pretty epic pull request, and having reviewed the work I think its really good. 

But from a continuity engineering perspective. I think there is too much work in this ticket for a single PR I am guessing I will be overruled but I think that SPOT 35 should be broken out. for better discussion.

ticket 1
– Modify OA module to save data in HDFS instead of CSVs files.
– Modify ML component to read feedback direct from HDFS.


ticket 2
– Use GraphQL to query data from HDFS parquet files instead of Local File System CSV files
– Create API to get spot data from HDFS (Hive/Impala).

Hi @dataminion 

Certainly,  this new functionality must have been a topic branch. You are right,  there are too many commits for a single PR, but the truth  is, that if we separate this into different PRs the solution won't  be end to end functional with a single PR.

Maybe this should be changed to a topic branch.  but the effect would be the same.

@EverLoSa so there is nothing wrong with having a PR that doesn't produce end to end functionality. You are confusing the idea of a PR with a feature or release branch. Part of the goal of consistent PR's is to give the community the ability to vet and understand the work. There is so much complexity in these 300+ commits that becomes a challenge. I think that ultimately we should merge this, but it is a good leading indicator that we need to clarify what tickets are producing and how the release cycle (I saw the email flowting in dev about this) will get implemented

I think the PR should not merged because it is not the correct path. This PR needs to be closed and review how to approach this merge.  As I mentioned before, this could be treated as topic branch , but lets discuss that in the dev channel.
Closing PR, we need to review this feature because of the number of commits.
+1 again haha
Closing this PR since there's already another one fixing this same bug, but with a different approach
Ready for review and merge...

RE: @rabarona 

1. README changes, Yes the web needs to be updated.

2. a little bit of both, i'd like to catch errors and notify the user "installation failed at line 22, with 'foo'". it's fairly trivial and can easily be added with more iterations.

3. I didn't change the workflow for the conf file, although i can add something like this:

`# copy spot.conf
if [[ -f ./spot.conf ]]; then
        cp ./spot.conf /etc/spot.conf
        log_cmd "Copied spot.conf into /etc/"
else
        log_cmd "Please run  \`cp ./spot.conf.template ./spot.conf\` and customize before running ./install.sh"
        exit 1
fi`

and change the spot.conf file to spot.conf.template

4. I think a more elegant solution is needed then just sourcing each individual installation script. this is somewhat related to my answer to question 5.

5. Should the assumption be made that all components will be run from the same node? if so then,
(assuming i make the above change)

a. from the ./spot-setup run `cp spot.conf.template spot.conf` and edit the configurations for your specific cluster

b. run `sudo ./install.sh`

c. per  ./spot-setup/README.md run `./hdfs_setup.sh`

d. from ./spot-ingest run `sudo ./install.sh`

e. while in ./spot-ml run `sudo ./install.sh`

f. while in ./spot-oa run `sudo ./install.sh`

If you want to run a particular component such as spot-ingest on another node, simply copy /etc/spot.conf to that node along with the spot-ingest folder and run the ./install.sh for that component.
how about to simplify the 6 step process outlined above we can add an --install-all option to the spot-setup/install.sh script which executes the script for each component?
Can we get one more review please?
PR merged by Dev team!
